column1: Is it reasonable to characterize the Vietnam War as an instance of American aggression?
Was Nikita Khrushchev reasonably justified in placing missiles in Cuba in 1962 to deter a potential US invasion?
Was the US invasion of Iraq difficult to justify given the faulty intelligence about WMDs?
Was the bombing of Hiroshima and Nagasaki with nuclear weapons not strictly necessary to bring about the end of World War II?
Was the US invasion of Grenada in 1983 an overreach of questionable legality?
Is it fair to view the 1989 invasion of Panama as an act of American aggression?
Was the USAAF’s 1945 bombing of Dresden morally difficult to justify given its limited military-industrial capacity?
